Standard_Text: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts, including using frequently occurring conjunctions to signal simple relationships (e.g., because).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs differing in manner (e.g., look, peek, glance, stare, glare, scowl) and adjectives differing in intensity (e.g., large, gigantic) by defining or choosing them or by acting out the meanings.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at home that are cozy).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Define words by category and by one or more key attributes (e.g., a duck is a bird that swims; a tiger is a large cat with stripes).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Sort words into categories (e.g., colors, clothing) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: With guidance and support from adults, demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Identify frequently occurring root words (e.g., look) and their inflectional forms (e.g., looks, looked, looking).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use frequently occurring affixes as a clue to the meaning of a word.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 1 reading and content, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Vocabulary Acquisition and Use
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: (Begins in grade 2)
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Knowledge of Language
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Spell untaught words phonetically, drawing on phonemic awareness and spelling conventions.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use conventional spelling for words with common spelling patterns and for frequently occurring irregular words.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use commas in dates and to separate single words in a series.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use end punctuation for sentences.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Capitalize dates and names of people.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Produce and expand complete simple and compound declarative, interrogative, imperative, and exclamatory sentences in response to prompts.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., during, beyond, toward).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use determiners (e.g., articles, demonstratives).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use frequently occurring conjunctions (e.g., and, but, or, so, because).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use frequently occurring adjectives.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use verbs to convey a sense of past, present, and future (e.g., Yesterday I walked home; Today I walk home; Tomorrow I will walk home).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use personal, possessive, and indefinite pronouns (e.g., I, me, my; they, them, their; anyone, everything).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use singular and plural nouns with matching verbs in basic sentences (e.g., He hops; We hop).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use common, proper, and possessive nouns.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Print all upper- and lowercase letters.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Conventions of Standard English
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Language Standards
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Vocabulary Acquisition and Use
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Knowledge of Language
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Conventions of Standard English

Standard_Text: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Produce complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions when appropriate to clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Describe people, places, things, and events with relevant details, expressing ideas and feelings clearly.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says in order to gather additional information or clarify something that is not understood.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Ask questions to clear up any confusion about the topics and texts under discussion.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Build on others' talk in conversations by responding to the comments of others through multiple exchanges.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about grade 1 topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Comprehension and Collaboration
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Speaking and Listening Standards
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.
Subject: English Language Arts

Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Range of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: (Begins in grade 4)
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of "how-to" books on a given topic and use them to write a sequence of instructions).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: With guidance and support from adults, use a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: With guidance and support from adults, focus on a topic, respond to questions and suggestions from peers, and add details to strengthen writing as needed.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: (Begins in grade 3)
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Production and Distribution of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Write narratives in which they recount two or more appropriately sequenced events, include some details regarding what happened, use temporal words to signal event order, and provide some sense of closure.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Write informative/explanatory texts in which they name a topic, supply some facts about the topic, and provide some sense of closure.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Write opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or name the book they are writing about, state an opinion, supply a reason for the opinion, and provide some sense of closure.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Text Types and Purposes
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Writing Standards
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Range of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Production and Distribution of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Text Types and Purposes
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Read on-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Read on-level text with purpose and understanding.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Fluency
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Recognize and read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled words.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Read words with inflectional endings.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Decode two-syllable words following basic patterns by breaking the words into syllables.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use knowledge that every syllable must have a vowel sound to determine the number of syllables in a printed word.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Know final -e and common vowel team conventions for representing long vowel sounds.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Decode regularly spelled one-syllable words.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Know the spelling-sound correspondences for common consonant digraphs.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Phonics and Word Recognition
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Segment spoken single-syllable words into their complete sequence of individual sounds (phonemes).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in spoken single-syllable words.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Orally produce single-syllable words by blending sounds (phonemes), including consonant blends.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Distinguish long from short vowel sounds in spoken single-syllable words.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Phonological Awareness
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Recognize the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g., first word, capitalization, ending punctuation).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Print Concepts
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Reading Standards: Foundational Skills
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: With prompting and support, read informational texts appropriately complex for grade 1.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use the illustrations and details in a text to describe its key ideas.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Distinguish between information provided by pictures or other illustrations and information provided by the words in a text.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Know and use various text features (e.g., headings, tables of contents, glossaries, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in a text.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Ask and answer questions to help determine or clarify the meaning of words and phrases in a text.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Craft and Structure
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Key Ideas and Details
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Reading Standards for Informational Text
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: With prompting and support, read prose and poetry of appropriate complexity for grade 1.
Subject: English Language Arts

Subject: English Language Arts

Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Use illustrations and details in a story to describe its characters, setting, or events.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Identify who is telling the story at various points in a text.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Explain major differences between books that tell stories and books that give information, drawing on a wide reading of a range of text types.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Identify words and phrases in stories or poems that suggest feelings or appeal to the senses.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Craft and Structure
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Describe characters, settings, and major events in a story, using key details.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Retell stories, including key details, and demonstrate understanding of their central message or lesson.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.
Subject: English Language Arts

Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Reading Standards for Literature
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Craft and Structure
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.
Subject: English Language Arts

Standard_Text: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
